data.text: @VPrasadMDMPH My county in OH has seen a decrease in COVID cases, and an increase in deaths in Feb.
@NetSpatial @VPrasadMDMPH This must be why almost no athlete's got covid and those that did never died from it!
@SeabassSay @VPrasadMDMPH At the bottom it says there is “insufficient data” for AZ. So I think that is why AZ is gray. Last I saw, AZ was one of the top states in terms of % who have had covid

@VPrasadMDMPH When modeling how COVID risks can be mitigated, pls also review this article and the research re #ExerciseVsCOVID outcomes as reported in BMJ Sports Medicine.  

https://t.co/1xkt63PfC6
@VPrasadMDMPH Well thats crazy. Everybody here has had it.

@VPrasadMDMPH It seems like your answer is always vaccinate/boost. It is puzzling you don't talk about effective early treatments. Data coming out of UK, Scotland and other jurisdictions indicate the protection from jabs fade fast and we cannot boost our way out.

@VPrasadMDMPH This does not bode well for kids in Maine.  We're still waiting for our gov to allow mask optional. 

And it's clear they are quite willing to make kids be mask up again when case counts go up - bc, that's what a well-functioning community does, turn to kids to protect them.
@VPrasadMDMPH As long as we keep mass testing young and healthy asymptomatic people mandates will never leave.
